lexUnit.name: poisonous.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: producing or of the nature of poison

sentence.text: Equipment in these hospitals was hopelessly inadequate , but at Verdun the situation was exacerbated still further by the poisonous environment , virulently contaminated by the thousands of putrifying corpses .
This is so even if they are poisonous , say , to mink .
Nitrite is also extremely poisonous to fish and hence the reason it is very important to check the pond water for the presence of either of these toxins .
Unknown to anyone the herring meal contained DMNA , a substance which was poisonous to mink .
Heliconius butterflies are poisonous to birds .
These clever little yellow and black-banded caterpillars actually store the alkaloids in their own bodies , giving them a bad and poisonous taste to any would-be predator .
The berries were poisonous and a notice to this effect was attached to the bush .
Central ca n't film here because since these photographs were taken the air 's become too poisonous to breath .
The leaves of yew trees are poisonous to cattle .
It contained no oxygen , but a lot of other gases that are poisonous to us , such as hydrogen sulfide ( the gas that gives rotten eggs their smell ) .
Forest Goblin shamans encourage small poisonous spiders to nest in their robes and live upon their bodies .
The goods actually supplied consisted of copra cake combined with a quantity of castor oil , the latter being poisonous to cattle .
The bacteriophage infects the bacterium , Staphylococcus , by taking over its cell chemistry and it is thought to cause the production of a toxic substance which is poisonous to human cells .

Early insecticides were crude , wide-spectrum contact killers , whereas modern ones are more often systemic in operation , that is , they make the crop temporarily poisonous to the pest and are increasingly specific .
When burnt , plastic produces poisonous byproducts .
HF is a dangerous chemical with a poisonous and corrosive vapour .
Susan was reminded of beautiful , poisonous sea anemones waving their fronds to suck in the unwary prey .
His mother says : ` Why , oh why , must they put these poisonous berries in colours so tempting to children ?
